content: Anonymous authentication is a privacy-preserving method that allows vehicles in VANETs to authenticate themselves without revealing their identity. In anonymous authentication, vehicles are assigned a temporary pseudonym, which is used to identify them in the network. This allows vehicles to communicate with other vehicles and the infrastructure network without revealing their true identity. Anonymous authentication can be achieved through various techniques such as group signatures, ring signatures, and identity-based signatures. These techniques allow vehicles to prove their membership in a group or their possession of a private key without revealing their true identity. Anonymous authentication can also be used in conjunction with other privacy-preserving techniques, such as location privacy protection methods, to enhance the overall privacy protection in VANETs.
